And is no less worthy of being beat within an inch of his life. Being publicly ridiculed having two fists shoved up his ass. Then the stranger we always thought it would be who never showed up. Cause it turns out the nature of rape has changed. We can now meet them in circles we frequent for companionship. See them at the coffeehouse with someone else we know. We could even have them over for dinner. And get raped in our own houses by invitation.. Donald puts his pad and pen away and sits down. Renee stands near Donald.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Ok we'll pick him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he is walking out two stretchers pass by with the children on them. Juanita comes in with Joanna and Gilda not far behind. Crystal is in shock, in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I wanna go with them.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: You have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Come on sit down. Juanita looks at Joanna. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 GOLDENROD REVISED 61.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Juanita hugs a very uncomfortable Joanna. She hugs her back. Joanna sits with Crystal who seems to be in shock. Alice comes into the emergency room. She goes up to the nurses station.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Nyla Adrose.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and a detective are talking to Nyla when the women walk in.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What do you remember about the place? Nyla turns away. Alice comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Mamma. Alice looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Rock of ages, let me hide myself in thee from this shame.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mamma.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Nyla we need you to tell us what happened. We're here to help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 GOLDENROD REVISED 62.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Speak child.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: All I remember is, Tubes, tables white washed windows, grime from age wiped over. Once legs spread anxious. Eyes crawling up on me, eyes rolling in my thighs. Metal horses gnawing. My womb dead. Alice starts to mumble and pray. Alice bolts out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really didn’t mean to. I really didn’t think I could. Just one day off. Get off of me. Alla this blood, bones shattered like soft ice-cream cones. I couldn't have you looking at me pregnant. I couldn’t have my friends see this dying, dangling ‘tween my legs. And I didn’t say a thing not a sigh or a fast scream, to get those eyes offa me. Get them steel rods outta me this hurts, this hurts me and nobody came. Cause nobody knew once I was pregnant and shamed of myself. Kelly gets up.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Thanks for calling me.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Sure. The nurse walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the counter we see a doctor talking to Crystal. The doctor gives Crystal the news that her children didn’t make it. She screams. Kelly turns around.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Is that? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Crazy ass man dropped her children out of the fifth story window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 GOLDENROD REVISED 63.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She walks closer to them as Donald and Renee in the process of questioning the women.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Did you all see it? The women nod.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to need to ask you all a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do you all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: We don't really.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: She works for me.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: I'm her building manager.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Crystal I know this is difficult but I need to know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TANGIE’S APARTMENT - DAY 77 Tangie is in her apartment there is a banging on the door. She sits with another man. The banging won’t stop she opens it. Alice slaps her back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Devil!

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Mamma stop it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You sent her there. You sent her there. A man comes out of the bedroom he looks on.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Evil lives in you. You are the child of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You alright baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You get out of here. You don't even know her name do you?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Go. The man leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you, all these men crawling inside of you. How can you be any relation to the God in me? She could have killed her.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: She could have killed me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I was with you, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You think that made it ok.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: She has gone crazy now. She’s an alcoholic demon. She goes towards her and tries to hit her. Tangie moves. Alice falls on the floor and hits her head. She crawls to the wall and sits on the floor looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This pair of you couldn’t have come from me. He wants you to have the money so you can control me like he did. When he put his hands up my dress, he didn't want me with anybody but him. He told me I was ugly. When I was fifteen he gave me to a white man. He told me he wanted a grand-girl that was beautiful not black like me, he told me not to sleep with the darkness, and then you came.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You stop lying.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: He touched you too.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Shut up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: He touched you too didn't he? I know it. Because of who you are.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You would always wear these orange butterflies and aqua sequins ensconced tween slight bosoms silk roses dartin from behind your ears. The passion flower of you meandered down hoover street past dark shuttered houses where women from Louisiana shelled peas round three o’clock and sent their sons whistlin to the store for fatback and black-eyed peas. You glittered in heat and seemed to be lookin for rides when you wazn’t and absolutely eyed every man who wazn’t lame, white, or noddin out. Look at you. You let your thigh slip from under your skirt crossin the street. You slowed to be examined. I saw you I watched you sullen. And the rhinestones etching the corners of your mouth suggested tears fresh kisses that had done no good. You always wore your stomach out lined with small iridescent feathers. The hairs round your navel seemed to dance and you didn’t let on that you knew from behind your waist waz aching to be held.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You don't know me, I am not a deliberate coquette who never did without. What I want and I wanted to be unforgettable. I wanted to be a memory, a wound to every man arrogant enough to want me. I am the wrath of women in windows fingerin shades. 01 lace curtains camouflaging despair and stretch marks. I glittered honestly delighted I am desired and allowed those especially schemin tactful suitors to experience my body and spirit. Tearin so easily blending with theirs. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And they were so happy and lay on my lime sheets full and wet from my tongue. I kissed them reverently even ankles edges of beards...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You are darkness.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Get out. Alice walks out. 78 INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 78 As Alice goes into the hallway Tangie follows. Gilda opens her door and looks at the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You think you’re so holy. You’re just like me! Tangie sees Gilda in her door.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you looking at you old bitch? Gilda stares at her. She tries to go back into her apartment the door is locked.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! Can you open the door.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Not until you take back those foul words you just said to me.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Damit old woman, open my door. She goes into her apartment and gets her key then comes and opens her door. Tangie goes in and slams the door. Gilda opens the door and enters the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISED
dialogues.text: INT. TANGIE’S APARTMENT — SAME DAY

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing in here? Gilda ignores her and goes to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you lost your damn mind. Get your ass out of my apartment. Gilda gets some ice from the freezer and puts it ina dish towel.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gilda.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Sit down and shut up.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell you one more time.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: If you don't put this ice on your face your going to be black and blue, do you want that? Tangie snatches the ice from her and sits down. Gilda takes it from her and puts it on her face.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It makes sense you know.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: You and your mother. Sleeping with all these men thinking it’s just sex. It ain't just sex honey, it all has a root. And you have to find the root to pluck it. At 4:30 a.m. you rise movin the arms and legs that trapped you. You sighed affirming the sculptured man and make yourself a bath of dark musk oil Egyptian crystals and Florida water to remove his smell to wash away the glitter to watch the butterflies melt into suds. (MORE )
79 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 GOLDENROD REVISED 68.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the rhinestones fall beneath her buttocks like smooth pebbles in a Missouri creek layin in water. You become yourself, ordinary brown braided woman with big legs and full lips regular. And the ones who fall prey to the dazzle of hips painted with orange blossoms and magnolia scented wrists had wanted no more than to lay between her sparklin thighs. And had planned on leavin before dawn. And you had been so divine devastatingly bizarre the way your mouth fit round. And now you stand a regular colored girl fulla the same malice livid indifference as a sistah worn from supportin a would-be horn player. But then you gather your tinsel and jewels from the tub. And laugh gayly or vengeful you stored your silk roses by your bed. And when you finished writin the account of her exploit in a diary embroidered with lilies and moonstones. You place the rose behind your ear and cried yourself to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Damn you listening to all my business through this wall.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: I used to be you. INT. JUANITA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 80 Juanita walks in. She looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Frank! Frank! No, not when I need you the most. Why do I do this shit to myself. She goes into the closet and she sees his clothes still hanging there she relaxes. Frank comes in the front door with a bag of groceries.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Hey. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I got dinner. She walks up to him and hugs him tight.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Just hold me. He puts the bag down and holds her tight. REVISED 69. 80

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You alright.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just hold me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ok. 81 INT. JOANNA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Joanna sits on the sofa with a drink in hand. Carl comes in.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Where’ve you been?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Playing basketball with the fellas. What’s wrong? He looks at her dress.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: My assistants children were murdered today. I saw it, I saw it. This woman works for me for eight years and I never knew she was being abused. What kind of person am I? She is in my office in my face everyday.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Come on lets get you cleaned up. He stands her up. He hugs her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re ok. You’re ok. He wipes her face and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm here. I'm sorry I was out. You should have called me.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 82 INT. JOANNA’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - NIGHT 82 Carl runs bath water for her.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I was sitting here trying to think who can I call, who will talk to me. And I realized that these women that I met today were closer to me than anybody I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 83 INT. DONALD AND KELLEY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 83 Kelly is sitting in the living room when he gets up out of the bed and looks for her.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Babe. Come on to bed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I was gonna have them removed but I went to the doctor. I said I’1l do it after lunch. And I forgot. I was going to see why I can’t have children, all the while leaving two in danger.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Babe it’s not your fault. Donald’s phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Babe.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Get it. He answers the phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 84 GOLDENROD REVISED 71.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Detective Watkins? Yeah ok, I got it. On my way. Babe, I gotta run to a scene, ok. We’ll talk about this when I get back ok.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Ok. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: I will. I love you

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I love you too. He runs out of the door. She gets up grabs her car keys and leaves after him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALICE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 84 Alice walks in the house with Nyla.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Mamma, I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: That, that what was growing inside of you was sin. It had to be destroyed. Pray and repent. Talk to Elohim. Talk to him Child. She takes several bottles of oil out of a cabinet and lights several candles.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t hear you praying.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Elohim, God of the most high I pray that you hear me. Alice pours oil in her head. She grabs her by the hair and slaps her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Come out of my daughter you demon. Come out by the power of Elohim. The graded son of man and the daughter of Jerusalem come out. She’s hugging Nyla around the neck tightly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A88
dialogues.text: 88 GOLDENROD REVISED 72.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Mamma, stop it. Nyla fights her off as Alice holds tighter.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: It's a spirit and it will come out. She hits her again. Nyla fights with her off and runs out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back child to the salvation of the Elohim. Come BACK! Come back. INT. YASMINE’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT 85 Yasmine is asleep, there is banging on her door. Yasmine jumps up and grabs the knife that is on her bedside. INT. YASMINE’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 86 She starts to shake as she goes to the door. There is a chair at the door and several locks are on it. She looks through the peephole and doesn't see anything. She then sits in a chair in the living room with the knife in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. YASMINE’S APARTMENT —- SAME NIGHT 87 We come down from the window were Yasmine sits staring at the front door to see Nyla running down the street.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT A88 Kelly sits in her car looking at the building on the verge of tears. Crystal comes out of the apartment with a bucket and starts cleaning the sidewalk. Kelly gets out of the car and walks over to her. EXT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT 88

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 GOLDENROD REVISED 73.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I can’t get this blood up. It’s here and people are walking on the blood of my children. Spitting. They don't have no respect for my babies. Kelly kneels down to help her. CRYSTAL (CONT’D) It's so quiet up there. There's a part of me that knows that this happened but most of me feels like I'm in a dream. Am I awake?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yes, you are.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I don't feel awake. This must be what death feels like. Nyla walks up right through the two women. CRYSTAL (CONT’D) Have some respect! Have some respect.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Nyla looks a fright she is sobbing and breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Nyla.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 89 Kelly is trying to clean Nyla up. Crystal looks on.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: And she started choking me.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You’‘re safe now. Crystal do you have a dry towel? Crystal stares at the window.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crystal, a dry towel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 90 GOLDENROD REVISED 74.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Crystal goes into the bathroom. They can hear a man’s voice and Tangie's voice coming from the hallway. Nyla gets up and goes outside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING- HALLWAY - NIGHT 90

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: You happy now.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: You sent me to that woman and you knew.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You should have just told me that you needed three hundred dollars for an abortion. Instead of lying. Nyla goes back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: My sister.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Can she come over and join us?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: She’s sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: And.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Mothafuka get your ass out of my apartment. And don't you let me see you again.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You crazy bitch. The man leaves. Tangie goes into Crystal’s apartment.  GOLDENROD REVISED 75. 91 INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 91

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: She had a fight with your mother. Tangie starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: It’s not funny.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Honey, with a mother like ours you better learn how to laugh to keep from crying. I got the oil too. I never thought she would do that to her favorite child. Tangie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Stop laughing at me! Tangie stops suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I know what it’s like to be laughed at. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Why do you hate me so much?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I don't hate you.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: You sure act like it.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I know, I’m sorry, you need to know something. You can’t love somebody who has that much hurt in them. I'm learning that more and more. I don't know what's wrong with me. I’ve lost touch with reality. I don’t know who’s doing it. I thought I was but I was so stupid. I was able to be hurt and that’s not real. Not anymore. We should be immune. If we’re still alive. How are we still live? My dependency on other living beings for love. I survive on intimacy? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 92 93 GOLDENROD REVISED 76.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And tomorrow, that’s all I’ve got going. And it is all I have, being alive and being a woman. Being colored is a metaphysical dilemma I haven't conquered yet. Do you see the point? Our spirits are too close to understand separation.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: We're sisters. Let us love each other as we are.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO - SAME 92

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Yasmine stands in front of the mirror and starts to dance. Her rhythm is off.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Once there were quadroon balls. Elegance in St. Louis laced mulattoes gambling down the Mississippi to Memphis, New Orleans and okra crepes near the bayou where the poor, white-trash would sing. Moaning strange liquid tones thru the swamps. She gets up and tries it again.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sechita had heard these things. She pushed the clinging delta dust with painted toes. The patch-work tent was polka-dotted. Stale lights snatched at the shadows. Creole Carnival waz playin Natchez. In ten minutes her splendid red garters gin-stained, became itchy on her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT - SAME NIGHT 93 Kelly pushes on the door to the bathroom. She pushes her way in with the help of Tangie. They find Crystal on the floor with a bottle of pills next to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Black diamond stockings darned wit yellow threads an ol starched taffeta can-can fell abundantly orange from her waist round the splinterin chair.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO - NIGHT 94 Yasmine dances alone in the studio.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Sechita Egyptian Goddess of creativity millennium threw her heavy hair in a coil over her neck. Sechita Goddess, the recording of history spread crimson oil on her cheeks, waxed her eyebrows and unconsciously slugged the last hard whiskey in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance stops and they get out rushing Crystal into the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The broken mirror she used to decorate her face made her forehead tilt backwards her cheeks appear sunken. Her sassy chin was just large enough to keep her full lower lip from growing into her neck.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO - NIGHT 96

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Sechita had learned to make allowances for distortions but the heavy dust of the delta left a tinge of grit and darkness on every one of her dresses. On her arms and her shoulders Sechita waz anxious to get back to St. Louis. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The dirt there didn't crawl from the earth into your soul. At least in St. Louis the grime waz store bought, second-second hand. Here in Natchez god seemed to be wipin his feet in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors are looking into Crystals eyes. They start to pump her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sechita could hear redneck whoops and slappin on the back. She gathered her sparsely sequined skirts tugged the waist cincher from under her greyin slips and made her face immobile. She made her face like Nefertiti approaching her own tomb.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO - SAME 98

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Yasmine continues to dance.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: She suddenly threw her leg full force thru the canvas curtain. A deceptive glass stone sparkled malignant on her ankle her calf was tauntin in the brazen carnie lights the full moon. Sechita goddess of love Egypt millenium performin the rites the conjuring of men, conjuring the spirit in Natchez the Mississippi spewed a heavy fume of barley. Movin waters Sechita’s legs slashed furiously thru the cracker nite and gold pieces hittin the makeshift stage her thighs they were aimin coins tween her thighs. Sechita Egypt goddess harmony kicked viciously thru the nite catchin stars tween her toes. There is a knock at the door. She stops cold and looks at it. She sees Donald flash his badge. She talks to him through the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasmine stands in front of a glass window. Donald motions for the doctor to uncover the body. Renee stands with Yasmine.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Yes. What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: He raped a woman and she stabbed him. I guess he got what was coming to him huh?

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the women sit around the waiting room. Gilda, Joanna, Kelly, Nyla and Tangie. Juanita walks up.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: They are pumping her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Can we see her?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Not just yet. Donald and Renee walk in with Yasmine. Donald sees Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Hey, hey honey. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: She tried to kill herself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Oh baby, I'm sorry. Carl and Joanna enter with coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Hi, how is she? Carl looks at Donald.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: She’s stable.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry this is my husband Carl.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: This is my husband Donald.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Let’s get some coffee. Good to meet all of you. Donald and Kelly walk away. DONALD (CONT’D) How are you?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I'm ok.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Good. How well do you know Joanna?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: All I know is that she’s Crystals boss.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: I just asked? Babe you know that you do a great job with these kids right?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Do I? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 101 102 GOLDENROD REVISED 81.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Yes, and I'm so glad that they have you to fight for them. You're going to be ok. I'm right here. I'm going to be sure you're ok. He looks back at Carl. Carl looks away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JUANITA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 101 Juanita comes into the house with flowers and a cake. She sneaks in, puts the cake on the kitchen counter and lights the candles. It reads “Happy Birthday Frank”. She takes the cake into the bedroom, where she can hear the TV on.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: I know when I left this morning you thought I forgot, but I didn't. INT. JUANITA’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT 102 She opens the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Happy birthday Frank. She turns the light on in the bedroom and no one is there. She sits the cake down on the dresser and turns off the TV. She notices that the dresser drawer is slightly opened. She opens it to see that it’s empty. She goes into the closet to see his side of the clothes are gone. She exits the closet and throws the cake against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Somebody almost walked off with all of my stuff and didn’t care enough to send a note home saying, I was late for my solo conversation or two sizes too small for my own tacky skirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly sits with Crystal feeding her.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What can anybody do with something of no value on a open market? Did you get a dime for my things? Hey man...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 104 INT. COMMUNITY CENTER- YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO -— 104 Yasmine is working with the girls in the dance class. They’re all in unison dancing as one.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where are you going with all my stuff? This is a woman’s trip and I need my stuff to oooh and ahhhh about.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 105 INT. JOANNA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 105 Joanna has dinner with Carl. She coughs as he walks away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Honest to God, somebody almost run off with all of my stuff. And I didn’t bring anything but the kick and sway of it. The perfect ass for my man and none of it is theirs. This is mine. Juanita’s own things. That’s my name. Now give me my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal lays on the sofa talking to the doctor. Juanita, Kelly and Nyla are there by her side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I see ya hidin’ my laugh. And how I sit with my legs open sometimes to give my crotch some sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TANGIE’S APARTMENT - DAY 107 Nyla and Tangie sit laughing and talking.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is some delicate leg and whimsical kiss I gotta have to give to my choice. No you can’t have me unless, I give me away. And I was doin’ all that, til ya run off on a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - JUANITA’S FREE CLINIC - DAY 108 Juanita is talking to a different group of women. Time has passed. The women seem to be lighter, laughing wearing different clothes.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: And who is this you left me with? Some simple bitch with a bad attitude. I wants my things. I want my arm with the hot iron scar and my leg with the flea bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal sits with the doctor. They are discharging her. Gilda takes her home.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I want my calloused feet and quick language back in my mouth. I want my own things. How I loved them. Somebody almost run off with all of my stuff. And I was standing there, lookin at myself, the whole time. It wasn't a spirit that ran  GOLDENROD REVISED 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanna gives Juanita a check for her clinic. The two ladies smile and talk.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Off with all my stuff. It was a man whose ego walked round like Rodan’s shadow. It was a man faster then my innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beau Willie sits in prison.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was a lover, I made too much room for. Almost run off with all my stuff. And the one running with it. Don’t know he got it. I’m shoutin this is mine.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 112 INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - JUANITA’S FREE CLINIC - DAY 1 Juanita sit with the women talking to them.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: And he don't know he got it. My stuff is the anonymous ripped off treasure of the year. Did you know somebody almost got away with me... me in a plastic bag under their arm? Me...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 113 INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 113 Tangie knocks on Crystal’s door. Gilda opens her door.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Why is it that every time somebody knocks on this door that yours opens?

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: What you want with her? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Get your nosy ass back in your apartment. Crystal opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: We’re having a get together at the community center tonight and we would love for you to come.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Please come, it will be good for you to get out. It’s in honor of my little sister going off to college. And she loves you.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: If I feel up to it.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Ok, you can bring somebody if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Ok, I’1l think about it. Crystal is about to close the door. Gilda looks on at Tangie.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Hey don't bring her. Tangie walks down the stairs and then comes back up.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you’re looking old lady.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: You can come too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 114 GOLDENROD REVISED 86.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Is that your way of apologizing to me? Tangie turns to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I notice you haven't had any visitors lately.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Mind your business.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: I see you’re starting to mind yours. The two women exchange a look. Tangie walks away. INT. JUANITA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 114 Juanita is getting ready to leave for a party. There’s a knock at the door, she opens it.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I tried to call you.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: This is over Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Every since I realized there was someone called a colored girl, an evil woman, a bitch or a nag. I been trying not to be that and leave bitterness in somebody else’s cup. Come to somebody to love me without deep and nasty smelling scars from lye or being left screaming in a street fulla lunatics, whispering slut, bitch, bitch. Niggah get outta here with alla that. I didn’t have any of that for you. I brought you what joy I found. And I found joy. And then there’s that woman who hurt you, who you left, three or four times. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you just went back after you put my heart in the bottom of your shoe. You just walked back to where you hurt. And I didn’t have nothing. So I went to where somebody had something for me. But none of them were you. I was on the way back from her house. In the bottom of your shoe. A real dead loving is here for you now. Cause I don’t know anymore, how to avoid my own face wet with my tears cause I had convinced myself Colored Girls had no right to sorrow. I lived for you, but I know I did it for myself. I couldn't stand it I couldn’t stand being sorry and colored at the same time. It’s so redundant in the modern world. You gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I guess this is good bye.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Like you’ve never seen it before. He walks out she closes the door she continues to get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal sits on the sofa, in the dark. Gilda knocks. She enters in with a plate of food. Gilda walks over to the window to open the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: No. Gilda stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Did you eat today? Gilda looks at the kitchen. She sees the breakfast she brought earlier still covered.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No you didn't. What's your plan? To lay here and die. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 GOLDENROD REVISED 87A.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: How could he do it?

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: How could you do it? Crystal looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: But I tried to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: You had to stop him long before he got to that window.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Are you saying this is my fault?

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Some of it. You got to take some responsibility in this. Now how much of it you want to take. It is up to you. But you have to take some. And until you do; you're going to live to die. Now I know this hurts but, you got to get up from here.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: But I didn't save my babies.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Then save some other woman's babies. Help another woman who is missing what you're missing. You got to get up from here. There is too much life wrapped in your voice. You got to get up from here. Gilda opens the curtains. She walks over to Crystal and sits down. She hugs her. The two women cry together. INT. JOANNA’S APARTMENT - EVENING 115 Joanna sits in a chair talking to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: My last husband, I hired a private detective to follow him. I looked at myself in the mirror one day and I said who are you? I wasn't going to do that with you. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And even though I didn't I know I ignored everything in me to have you.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Will you just tell me what the hell you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I went to my gynecologist and before I met you. Every level in my body was fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Wait are you sick? Baby talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Tell me the truth. Who have you been sleeping with?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I promise you since we’ve been together I have not slept with another woman.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What about a man?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I see the way you look at them when you think I'm not paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You accusing me of this? You have no idea how much I hate coming in this damn house sometimes. Every day if you ain't trying to tell me what to wear or calling shots over my head, this is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes, I don't know what the hell you are talking about Joanna.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Are you gay?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What, how the hell you gonna ask me something like that.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Are you gay? Be a man for once and answer the damn question.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Be a man? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes dammit, be a man instead of that fucking kid that I've been taking care of.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Joanna stop it.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What kind of man marry's a woman then sneaks around and around letting another man bend him over.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Nobody bends me over?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: So you do the bending.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You wanna know what I am? I'ma man that is sick of your shit. I’m not going to wake up next to a man, kiss him and hold him. That ain't me, holding hands some mans hand walking down the street that's a gay man, that ain't me.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I'm a man that can enjoy sex with aman. No attachments it’s just sex. And I’m sorry if you can’t handle my truth.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Save your sorry. One thing I don't need is any more apologies. I got sorry greeting me at my front door. You can keep yours. I don’t know what to do with them. I'm gonna have to throw some away I can’t get to the clothes in my closet for all the sorries. I'm gonna tack a sign on my door, leave a message by the phone. If you called to say you’re sorry, call somebody else. I don't use ‘em anymore. I let sorry, didn’t mean to, and how could I know about that take a walk down a dark and musty street in Brooklyn. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 116 GOLDENROD REVISED 90.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do exactly what I want to and I won’t be sorry for none of it. Let a sorry soothe your soul. I'm gonna soothe mine. You were always inconsistent doing something and then being sorry. Beating my heart to death talking bout you sorry. Well I will not call, I'm not going to be nice. I will raise my voice, scream and holler, break things and race the engine and tell all your secrets bout yourself to your face. I won't be sorry for none of it. I loved you on purpose I was open on purpose. I still crave vulnerability and loose talk. I'm not even sorry bout you being sorry. You can carry all the guilt and grime ya wanna just don't give it to me. I can’t use another sorry. Next time you should admit you’re mean, down low and low down, trifling. And no count straight out. Instead of being sorry all the time, enjoy being yourself. When I get back I want you gone and take your HIV with you. She puts her test results down in front of him and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - YASMINE’S RHYTHMS - NIGHT 116 Yasmine is dancing with all of the girls, Nyla is dancing happy. There is a huge congratulations banner hanging above the DJ. Alice comes in. Tangie goes over to her, dancing up on her. Alice seems very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: What’s up Alice?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I bought you some things for her. She gives her a box.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Is it ticking? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Come on. Alice walks up to Nyla.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I'm very proud of you. Elohim blessed. Here?

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Yes he did.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: It’s the temple bible.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Thank you mamma. You want some food?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: No, I'm fasting, I’m going to go now. This music is of the devil. She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I don't know what’s worse the betrayal or the virus.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: HIV is not a death sentence. I have patients that have been on their meds living a great life for over twenty years. Its gonna be ok.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I was that stupid.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Honey, it could have been any of us. You were not stupid you were in love. We deal with emotion too much. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So why don’t we go on ahead and be white then and make everything dry and abstract with no rhythm and no feeling for sheer sensual pleasure. Yes let’s go on and be white. We’re right in the middle of it. No use holding out holding onto ourselves. Let’s think our way outta feeling. Let’s abstract ourselves some families and maybe tonight. I’11 find a way to make myself come without him. No fingers or other objects just thought, which isn’t spiritual evolution.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Thinking won’t do me a bit of good tonight. I need to be loved. And haven't the audacity to say where are you?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: And don’t know who to say it to. The ladies come up the stairs. Gilda and

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Look who’s here. Crystal come in. The other women follow her up.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: There was no air.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Are you having a good time?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Surprisingly I am. I usually need a man around to have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: No, let them stay where they are. My love is too beautiful to have thrown back on my face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: Oh, I like that.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Try one.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: I do this with the class. We say my love is too..., you fill that part in.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: My love is too sanctified to have thrown back on my face.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: My love is too magic to have thrown back on my face.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: My love is too Saturday night to have thrown back on my face.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: My love is too complicated to have thrown back on my face.

dialogues.speaker: YASMINE
dialogues.text: My love is too music to have thrown back on my face.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: And you remember that the next time some man tries to walk away with all your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I know that’s right. Or says I'm sorry a million times.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: We all got I’m sorry stories don't we.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Get this, last week my ex came in saying,”I don’t know how she got your number baby”. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: No this one is it. “Oh, baby, ya know I was high. I’m sorry.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 GOLDENROD REVISED 94.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I’m only human, and inadequacy is what makes us human. And if we was perfect we wouldn’t have nothing to strive for. So you might as well go on and forgive me cause I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: No this one is it. I do ya like I do ya cause I thought ya could take it. No, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Now I know that you know I love ya, but I ain’t ever gonna love ya like ya want me to love ya. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Shut up bitch, I told you I was sorry. All the women look at her and get serious for a second. This is the first time we notice that the women are wearing the same colors as they were in the beginning red, orange, purple, yellow, green and brown. CRYSTAL (CONT’D) It’s ok. I asked myself how I could let that happen and I realized that I was missing something. Something so important. Something promised. A laying on of hands Fingers near my forehead Strong. Cool. Moving. Makin me whole. Sense. Pure. All of God coming into me laying me open to myself. I was missing something.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Something promised.

dialogues.speaker: JUANITA
dialogues.text: Something free.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: A laying on hands.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: I know bout’ laying on bodies, laying outta man. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bringing him all of my fleshy self and some of my pleasure being taken full eager wet like I get sometimes. I was missing something.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: A laying on of hands.

dialogues.speaker: TANGIE
dialogues.text: Not a man. Laying on.

dialogues.speaker: NYLA
dialogues.text: Not my Mama, holding me tight, saying I'm always gonna be her girl.

dialogues.speaker: GILDA
dialogues.text: Not a laying on of a bosom and womb a laying on of hands the holiness of myself released.

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: I sat up one night walking my apartment floors screaming, crying. The ghost of another woman who was missing what I was missing I wanted to jump outta my bones and be done with myself. Leave me alone and go on in the wind. It was too much. I fell into a numbness til the only tree I could see took me up in her branches held me in the breeze. Made me dawn dew that chill at daybreak the sun wrapped me up swingin rose light everywhere the sky laid over me like a million men. I was cold. I was burnin up. A child and endlessly weaving garments for the moon with my tears I found God in myself and I loved her I loved her fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: WRITTEN ON THE SCREEN IN ALL COLORS OF THE RAINBOW
dialogues.text: And this is for colored girls who have considered suicide but are moving to the ends of their own rainbows.
